text: Stanley Lawrence Crouch (December 14, 1945 â€“ September 16, 2020) was an American poet, music, and cultural critic. He was best known for his jazz criticism and his 2000 novel Don't the Moon Look Lonesome? Crouch was born in Los Angeles. He was also a known critic of jazz in New York City and worked with The New York Times. Crouch died on September 16, 2020 at a hospital in New York City at the age of 74.Stanley Crouch, Towering Jazz Critic, Dead At 74 == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American poets Category:American music critics Category:American columnists Category:Journalists from California Category:Journalists from New York City Category:Writers from Los Angeles
title: Stanley Crouch
